item.title: Tomb: A Simple and Secure Linux Encryption Tool
item.description:
What is Tomb?

Tomb is a free and open-source encryption tool for GNU/Linux that allows users to create encrypted storage containers (called tombs) and protect their keys with GnuPG. It’s designed to be scriptable, lightweight, and secure, making it ideal for privacy-focused users who prefer the terminal.

item.title: Top 10 Secure Messaging Platforms Compared
item.description: In an age where digital communication is constant and privacy threats are ever-evolving, secure messaging apps are more critical than ever. This post compares 10 of the most secure messaging platforms based on encryption, open-source status, privacy policies, and usability.
